p: The 28 g of the nutrient agar were weighed and taken in the 1000 mL of distilled water, warmed continually until appearance of bubbles followed by sterilization at 121 oC as well as 15 psi in an autoclave for a period of 15 minutes. Bacterial inoculums have been prepared on the nutrient agar from a 24 h pure culture. The 8 g of the nutrient broth were taken in 1 liter of the distilled water, dissolved and then sterilized in an autoclave at 121 oC as well as 15 psi for a period of 20 minutes. In a conical flask, 50 ÂµL of culture stock solution was added in 50 mL of broth solution followed by the shaking over a horizontal shaker. Then spectroscopically the cell turbidity was measured after the duration of 24 h and compared to that of the 0.5 McFarland standards. After that, inoculum was ready in order to use for antibacterial activity.
